Key Match Events: Dominic Fletcher hits a one-run double in the ninth inning to give the White Sox the lead
Chicago White Sox tack on four more runs in the ninth inning for a 7-2 victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: The victory snapped a streak of 20 straight games in which the White Sox lost Chris Flexen's starts — the longest such stretch in MLB history
Others: The White Sox need to go 10-8 in their final 18 games to avoid tying the 1962 New York Mets (40-120) for the most losses in Major League Baseball’s modern era
